<body bgcolor="#ffffff" style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">
<br>
<br>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New 
Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Exhibit 31.2</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">PANEX RESOURCES INC. CERTIFICATIONS PURSUANT
TO SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-
DECORATION: underline">CERTIFICATION</font></font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Ross Doyle, certify that:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">1.&#160; I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q for
the quarter ended May 31, 2013 of Panex Resources Inc.;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">2.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, this quarterly report does
not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material 
fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under 
which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period 
covered by this report;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">3.&#160;&#160;Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, 
and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all 
material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows 
of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this 
report;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">4.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying 
officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure 
controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-
15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused
such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its 
consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, 
particularly during the period in which this report is being 
prepared;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or
caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our 
supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of 
financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external 
purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s
disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions 
about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end
of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">5.&#160;&#160;The registrant&#8217;s other certifying 
officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal
control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the 
audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s board of directors (or persons 
performing the equivalent functions):</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the
design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are 
reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, 
process, summarize and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves 
management or other employees who have a significant role in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="FONT-STYLE: italic; DISPLAY: inline; FONT-
FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">/s/ Ross 
Doyle</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Ross Doyle</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Chief Financial Officer</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">July 12, 2013</font></div>
<br>

0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

1350, AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 
2002</font></div>

0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<pre>
</pre>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with the Quarterly Report of Panex Resources Inc.
(the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-Q for the period ended May 31, 2013 as 
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the 
&#8220;Report&#8221;), I, Klaus Eckhof, President, Chief Executive Officer of 
the Company and sole member of the Board of Directors, certify, pursuant to 
s.906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</font></div>
<pre>
</pre>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<pre>

</td>

</tr></table></div>

<pre>
</pre>

<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 
1350, AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 
2002</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with the Quarterly Report of Panex Resources Inc.
(the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-Q for the period ended May 31, 2013 as 
filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date hereof (the 
&#8220;Report&#8221;), I, Ross Doyle, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, and 
Corporate Secretary of the Company, certify, pursuant to s.906 of the Sarbanes-
Oxley Act of 2002, that:</font></div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div>
<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%" style="FONT-SIZE: 
10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">

<td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" 
align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Report fully complies with the requirements of section 
13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</font></div>
</td>
</tr></table>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 
0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT:

<div>

10pt">2)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
</td>
<td>

align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;

material aspects, the financial condition and result of operations of the 
Company.</font></div>

    <us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureText
Block contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;1.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization, Nature of Business, Going Concern and 
Management&amp;#146;s 
Plans&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Panex Resources Inc. (&amp;#145;Panex&amp;#148; or 
the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;)&#13;was incorporated in the State of Nevada on 
May 28, 2004. The Company is considered to be an Exploration Stage Company. The 
Company&amp;#146;s&#13;principal business is the acquisition and exploration of 
mineral resources.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Going concern and management&amp;#146;s 
plans:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The accompanying 
financial statements have been prepared assuming&#13;that the Company will 
continue as a going concern.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Since its inception on May 28, 
2004, the Company has not generated&#13;revenue and has incurred net 
losses.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company incurred a net loss of $116,730 for the 
nine months ended May 31, 2013,&#13;and a deficit accumulated during the 
exploration stage of $13,586,159 for the period May 28, 2004 (inception) through
May 31, 2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Accordingly,&#13;it has not generated cash flow
from operations and has primarily relied upon advances from shareholders and 
proceeds from equity&#13;financings to fund its 
operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These conditions raise substantial doubt about 
the Company&amp;#146;s ability to continue&#13;as a going 
concern.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company has no
mineral property interests as of the date of 
this&#13;report.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Certain mineral property interests are 
presently being considered, however it is too early to determine 
whether&#13;they may be considered appropriate for 
acquisition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;During the next 12
months, management&amp;#146;s objective is to recapitalize&#13;Panex, continue 
to raise new capital and to seek new investment opportunities in the mineral 
sector.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Management believes&#13;that its worldwide industry 
contacts will make it possible to identify and assess new projects for 
acquisition purposes.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Panex is seeking a viable business opportunity 
through acquisition,&#13;merger or other suitable business combination method, 
with a focus on undervalued mineral properties for eventual
acquisition.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex&#13;intends to concentrate its acquisition
efforts on mineral properties or mineral exploration businesses that management 
believes&#13;to be undervalued or that management believes may realize a 
substantial benefit from being publicly owned.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex 
will&#13;continue to identify and assess undervalued mineral properties when 
capital raisings are completed.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A small number of&#13;mineral
properties are presently being reviewed, but it is too early to say whether they
may be considered appropriate for acquisition.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The financial statements do not include any 
adjustments to reflect&#13;the possible future effects on the recoverability and
classification of assets or the amounts or classification of 
liabilities&#13;that may result from the possible inability of the Company to 
continue as a going concern.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureText
Block>
    <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-
01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt
;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;a.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Basis of 
Preparation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;These financial statements and related notes are 
presented in accordance&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the
United States (US GAAP).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s fiscal year-
end is&#13;August 31.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;b.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
conformity with US GAAP&#13;requires management to make estimates and 
assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and 
disclosure&#13;of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses&#13;during the 
reporting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual results could differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;c.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Basic and Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per 
Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing 
net income (loss)&#13;available to common stockholders by the weighted average 
number of common shares outstanding during the reporting period 
including&#13;common stock issued effective the date 
committed.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Common stock issuable is considered outstanding as
of the original&#13;approval date for the purposes of earnings per share 
computations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Diluted earnings (loss) per common share is 
computed&#13;by dividing net earnings (loss) by the sum of (a) the basic 
weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during&#13;the 
period and (b) additional shares that would have been issued and potentially 
dilutive securities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the reporting&#13;periods the 
diluted earnings (loss) per share was equivalent to the basic earnings (loss) 
per share because all potentially dilutive&#13;securities were anti-dilutive due
to the net losses incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Potentially dilutive securities 
consist of stock options&#13;outstanding at the end of the reporting 
period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;d.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Cash&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Cash includes deposits in banks, which are 
unrestricted as to withdrawal&#13;or use.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;e.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Mineral Property and Exploration 
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company has been in the exploration stage since 
its formation&#13;on May 28, 2004 and has not realized any revenues from its 
planned operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;It has been primarily engaged in 
the&#13;acquisition and exploration of mining 
properties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Mineral property acquisition and exploration 
costs are expensed as&#13;incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;When it has been 
determined that a mineral property can be economically developed as a result of 
establishing&#13;proven and probable reserves, the costs incurred to develop 
such property are capitalized.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such costs will be 
amortized&#13;using the units-of-production method over the estimated life of 
the probable reserve.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;If mineral properties are 
subsequently&#13;abandoned or impaired, any capitalized costs will be charged to
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;f.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Deferred Acquisition 
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company capitalizes deposits paid during the 
acquisition of equity&#13;interests as deferred acquisition 
costs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Deferred acquisition costs are recorded at cost and 
are included in the purchase&#13;price of the equity interest once the 
acquisition has been consummated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;g.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Fair value is defined as the price that would be 
received to sell&#13;an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly 
transaction between market participants at the measurement date in the 
principal&#13;or most advantageous market. The Company uses a fair value 
hierarchy that has three levels of inputs, both observable and 
unobservable,&#13;with use of the lowest possible level of input to determine 
fair value.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times,
 Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 1 - quoted 
prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical&#13;assets or 
liabilities;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 2 - 
observable inputs other than Level 1, quoted prices for&#13;similar assets or 
liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets and
liabilities in markets that&#13;are not active, and model-derived prices whose 
inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are observable; 
and&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 3 - assets 
and liabilities whose significant value drivers&#13;are 
unobservable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;As of reporting period, the Company did 
not have any assets or liabilities&#13;that were measured at fair value on a 
recurring or non-recurring basis.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Observable inputs are based on market data obtained 
from independent&#13;sources, while unobservable inputs are based on the 
Company&amp;#146;s market assumptions. Unobservable inputs require 
significant&#13;management judgment or estimation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In some 
cases, the inputs used to measure an asset or liability may fall into 
different&#13;levels of the fair value hierarchy.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In those 
instances, the fair value measurement is required to be classified using&#13;the
lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. Such 
determination requires significant 
management&#13;judgment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent:
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Financial instruments, which include cash, accounts 
payable, and&#13;loans and borrowings, were estimated to approximate their 
carrying values due to the immediate or short-term maturity of 
these&#13;financial instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The fair value of amounts 
due to related parties are not practical to estimate, due to the 
related&#13;party nature of the underlying transactions.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
financial risk to the Company&amp;#146;s operations arises from 
fluctuations&#13;in foreign exchange rates and the degree of volatility of these
rates. Currently, the Company does not use derivative instruments&#13;to reduce 
its exposure to foreign currency risk.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;h.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company recognizes deferred tax assets and 
liabilities for the&#13;future tax consequences attributable to differences 
between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and 
liabilities&#13;and their tax bases, as well as net operating 
losses.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Deferred tax 
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax&#13;rates expected to 
apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are 
expected to be recovered or settled.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;effect on 
deferred tax assets or liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in the
period in which the tax change occurs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A&#13;valuation 
allowance is provided to reduce the deferred tax assets to a level, that more 
likely than not, will be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Management does not believe that the Company has any
unrecognized&#13;tax positions. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize 
interest and penalties accrued on any unrecognized tax benefits as 
a&#13;component of income tax expense.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;i.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Stock-Based 
Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company accounts for share-based payments under 
the fair value&#13;method of accounting for stock-based compensation consistent 
with US GAAP.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the fair value method, stock-
based&#13;compensation cost is measured at the grant date based on the fair 
value of the award using the Black-Sholes option pricing model&#13;and is 
recognized to expense on a straight-line basis over the requisite service 
period, which is generally the vesting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Where&#13;upon
grant the options vest immediately the stock-based costs are expensed 
immediately.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;j.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Foreign Currency Translation and 
Transactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s functional and reporting 
currency is the United&#13;States dollar.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Monetary assets and
liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated into the United 
States&#13;dollar using the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet 
date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Gains and losses arising on settlement 
of&#13;foreign currency denominated transactions or balances are included in the
determination of income.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;k.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Concentration of Credit 
Risk&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments that 
are exposed to concentration&#13;of credit risk consist of 
cash.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s cash is in demand deposit 
accounts placed with federally insured&#13;financial institutions in 
Canada.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;l.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Interim Financial 
Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
 style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the opinion of
management, the accompanying unaudited condensed&#13;financial statements 
contain all adjustments which include only normal recurring adjustments, 
necessary to present fairly the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;financial position, 
results of operations and cash flows for the periods shown. The results of 
operations for such periods are&#13;not necessarily indicative of the results 
expected for a full year or for any future period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The unaudited financial statements should
be read in conjunction&#13;with the Company&amp;#146;s audited financial 
statements and footnotes thereto for the year ended August 31, 2012, which are 
included&#13;in the Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-
K.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt

8pt"&gt;m.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td

accounting pronouncements&#13;to determine their applicability and does not

intrinsic value in the table above represents
 the total&#13;pre-tax intrinsic value for all &amp;#147;in-the-money&amp;#148; 
options (i.e. the difference between the Company&amp;#146;s closing 
stock&#13;price on the last trading day of the fiscal year and the exercise 
price, multiplied by the number of shares) that would have been&#13;received by 
the option holders had all option holders exercised their options on May 31, 
2013.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Effective August 3, 2012, the 
Company&amp;#146;s board of directors&#13;granted 8,000,000 stock purchase 
options.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Each of the options has an issue date, effective 
date and vesting date of&#13;August 3, 2012, with an exercise price of $0.08 per
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The term of these options is five 
years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The options&#13;are exercisable at any time from the 
grant date up to and including August 2, 2017.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There is no 
unrecognised compensation&#13;expense at February 28, 
2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All related compensation expense was recognized on 
August 31, 2012 as the options were&#13;vested in full on that 
date.&lt;/p&gt;</us-

    <us-gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-
31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;5.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Loans and 
Borrowings&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&
lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In March and July 2007, the Company received loan 
proceeds of $240,000&#13;and $500,000 respectively from an unrelated third 
party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These loans were unsecured bearing interest at 8% per 
annum,&#13;with no fixed repayment date, but the understanding with the lender 
was that the loans will be repaid from the proceeds of future&#13;equity 
financings and/or the repayment of amounts lent to 
Minanca.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On December 20, 2010, principal of $46,892 and 
interest&#13;of $15,751 was assigned to this third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In 
December 2010, $267,072 of this loan as well as $200,310 of accrued&#13;interest
on this loan was settled by the issue of 9,347,640 shares.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In
May 31, 2012 this loan was settled in full for&#13;$560,000, resulting in a gain
on extinguishment of $10,426, which is included within interest income and other
for the year ended&#13;August 31, 2012.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In January 2011, the Company received loan proceeds 
of $50,000, from&#13;an unrelated third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This loan was
unsecured, and had no stated interest rate.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This amount was 
settled&#13;for issuance of 2,500,000 shares of common stock in February 
2012.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In September and 
November 2012, the Company received loan proceeds&#13;of $75,000 and $25,000 
respectively (totalling $100,000), from an unrelated third 
party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The loan is unsecured, and&#13;has no stated interest 
rate.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$75,000 of these funds received was used to 
pay aged outstanding accounts payable&#13;in December 2012.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:DebtDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;6.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Material Contingencies and 
Commitments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Panex has no material contingencies or long-term 
commitments.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;While Panex has raised capital to meet 
its working capital and financing&#13;needs in the past, additional financing is
required in order to fully complete its plan of operation and launch its 
business operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex&#13;is seeking financing in the 
form of equity in order to provide the necessary working 
capital.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex currently has no&#13;commitments for 
financing.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There are no assurances Panex will be completely 
successful in raising the funds required.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-
01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;7.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Stockholders&amp;#146; 
Equity&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Common Stock&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Panex&amp;#146;s authorized capital stock consists 
of 500,000,000 shares&#13;of common stock at a par value of $0.001 per 
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On August 30, 2010, the authorized capital was 
increased from 75,000,000&#13;shares of common stock to 500,000,000 shares of 
common stock.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Stock 
cancellations and recapitalization:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On May 25, 2006 and June 9, 2006, the Company 
completed the return&#13;and cancellation of 30,000,000 and 6,000,000 common 
shares to the treasury, respectively.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The shares were 
returned by&#13;the former president of the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The net loss per share amounts and 
stockholders&amp;#146; equity (deficit)&#13;have been retroactively restated 
(accounted for as a recapitalization) to reflect the return and cancellation of 
36,000,000 common&#13;shares by the former president of the 
Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Common stock 
issuances&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On May 28, 2004, 
the Company issued 6,000,000 shares of common stock&#13;to the then President of
the Company for reimbursement of legal expenses of $500 incurred on behalf of 
the Company.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On June 30, 2005, 
the Company issued 6,000,000 shares of common stock&#13;for cash proceeds of 
$25,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On April 15, 2005,
the Company issued 22,500,000 shares of common&#13;stock for cash proceeds of 
$18,750.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On March 22, 2005 
the Company issued 36,000,000 shares of common&#13;stock for cash proceeds of 
$3,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On June 8, 2006, 
the Company completed a private placement with a&#13;director of the Company for
714,285 common shares at a price of $2.80 per share for proceeds of 
$2,000,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On August 30, 
2006, the Company completed a private placement of&#13;1,250,000 units at a 
price of $2.00 per unit for proceeds of $2,500,000. Each unit consisted of one 
common share and one common&#13;share purchase warrant.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Each share purchase warrant entitles the holder to 
acquire one additional&#13;common share at an exercise price of $2.50 per share 
for a period of two years. All warrants expired unexercised on August 
31,&#13;2008.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;During November 
2006, the Company completed private placements for&#13;3,095,000 shares of 
restricted common stock at $0.80 per share, raising proceeds of 
$2,476,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In January 2007 
the Company completed two private placements for&#13;3,187,500 shares of 
restricted common stock at $0.80 per share raising proceeds of 
$2,550,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In February 2007 
the Company completed two private placements for&#13;1,350,000 shares of 
restricted common stock at $0.80 per share raising proceeds of 
$1,080,000.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On February 28, 
2009, the board of directors authorized the issuance&#13;of 14,100,000 
restricted shares of common stock at a subscription price of $0.01 per 
restricted share, for cash proceeds of $16,000&#13;and the settlement of 
$125,000 accrued liabilities and debt. The shares were issued on June 19, 
2009.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On May 29, 2009, 
the Company completed a private placement for 1,500,000&#13;shares of restricted
common stock at price of $0.01 per restricted share in exchange for the 
settlement of $15,000 debt.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In October 2009, the Company issued 6,350,000 
restricted shares of&#13;common stock at a subscription price of $0.01 per 
restricted share, for cash proceeds of $40,000 and the settlement of 
$23,500&#13;in accrued liabilities and debt due to a related 
party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The cash was received in December 
2008.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In January 2010, the Company issued 1,000,000 
restricted shares of&#13;common stock at a subscription price of $0.01 per 
restricted share, for the settlement of $10,000 in accrued liabilities and 
debt&#13;due to a related party.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On December 20, 2010, the Company issued 2,955,483 
restricted shares&#13;of common stock at a subscription price of $0.05 per 
share, for the settlement of $147,774 in accounts payable and accrued 
liabilities&#13;and issued 9,347,640 restricted shares of common stock at a 
subscription price of $0.05 per share for the settlement of loans 
and&#13;accrued interest totaling $467,382 from an unrelated third 
party.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On June 15, 2012, 
the Securities and Exchange Commission declared&#13;Panex&amp;#146;s Form S-1 
Registration Statement effective, file number 333-172375, permitting Panex to 
offer up to 30,000,000 shares&#13;of common stock at $0.08 per share.&amp;#160; 
The offering was being conducted on a best efforts basis and there was no 
underwriter&#13;involved in this public offering.&amp;#160; Through August 31, 
2012, Panex received and accepted 22 subscription agreements and received&#13;an
aggregate $978,989 in proceeds from those subscriptions and issued 12,237,075 
shares of common stock.&amp;#160; No further subscriptions&#13;were received and
the offering was closed on December 12, 2012.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex utilized
 the proceeds to ongoing operations, paying&#13;accounts payable, paying for 
offering expenses, assessing and evaluating possible new mineral project 
opportunities, and, subject&#13;to acquiring any such new projects, funding the 
exploration on such projects.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Effective August 3, 2012, the Company&amp;#146;s 
board of directors&#13;granted 8,000,000 stock purchase 
options.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Each of the options has an issue date, effective 
date and vesting date of&#13;August 3, 2012, with an exercise price of $0.08 per
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The term of these Options are five 
years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;Options are exercisable at any time from the 
grant date up to and including August 2, 2017.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On April 11, 2013, the Company issued 15,000,000 
restricted shares&#13;of common stock at a subscription price of $0.005 per 
share, for the settlement of $75,000 in accounts payable and accrued 
liabilities.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Financing 
Activities:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;During April 2013, the Company entered 
into debt settlement agreements&#13;with creditors in consideration for the
issuance of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock, par value $0.001, at a per 
share price of&#13;$0.005 per share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As a result, the Company
extinguished certain liabilities as further set forth in the debt 
settlement&#13;agreements as follows:&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table

Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;These financial statements and related notes are 
presented in accordance&#13;with accounting principles generally accepted in the
United States (US GAAP).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s fiscal year-
end is&#13;August 31.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman,

    <us-gaap:UseOfEstimates contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31">&lt;table 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr 
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;b.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
conformity with US GAAP&#13;requires management to make estimates and 
assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and 
disclosure&#13;of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses&#13;during the 
reporting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual results could differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:UseOfEstimates>
    <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-
05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;c.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Basic and Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per 
Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing
net income (loss)&#13;available to common stockholders by the weighted average 
number of common shares outstanding during the reporting period 
including&#13;common stock issued effective the date 
committed.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Common stock issuable is considered outstanding as
of the original&#13;approval date for the purposes of earnings per share 
computations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Diluted earnings (loss) per common share is 
computed&#13;by dividing net earnings (loss) by the sum of (a) the basic 
weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during&#13;the 
period and (b) additional shares that would have been issued and potentially 
dilutive securities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the reporting&#13;periods the 
diluted earnings (loss) per share was equivalent to the basic earnings (loss) 
per share because all potentially dilutive&#13;securities were anti-dilutive due
to the net losses incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Potentially dilutive securities 
consist of stock options&#13;outstanding at the end of the reporting 
period.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-
01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;d.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Cash&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Cash includes deposits in banks, which are 
unrestricted as to withdrawal&#13;or use.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 
8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:CapitalizationOfInternalCostsPolicy contextRef="From2012-09-
01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;e.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Mineral Property and Exploration 
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company has been in the exploration stage since 
its formation&#13;on May 28, 2004 and has not realized any revenues from its 
planned operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;It has been primarily engaged in 
the&#13;acquisition and exploration of mining 
properties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Mineral property acquisition and exploration 
costs are expensed as&#13;incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;When it has been 
determined that a mineral property can be economically developed as a result of 
establishing&#13;proven and probable reserves, the costs incurred to develop 
such property are capitalized.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such costs will be 
amortized&#13;using the units-of-production method over the estimated life of 
the probable reserve.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;If mineral properties are 
subsequently&#13;abandoned or impaired, any capitalized costs will be charged to
operations.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:CapitalizationOfInternalCostsPolicy>
    <DBGF:DeferredAcquisitionCosts contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-
31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;f.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Deferred Acquisition
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company capitalizes deposits paid during the 
acquisition of equity&#13;interests as deferred acquisition 
costs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Deferred acquisition costs are recorded at cost and 
are included in the purchase&#13;price of the equity interest once the 
acquisition has been consummated.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</DBGF:DeferredAcquisitionCosts>
    <us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-
01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: 
right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;g.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Fair value is defined as the price that would be 
received to sell&#13;an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly 
transaction between market participants at the measurement date in the 
principal&#13;or most advantageous market. The Company uses a fair value 
hierarchy that has three levels of inputs, both observable and 
unobservable,&#13;with use of the lowest possible level of input to determine 
fair value.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 1 - quoted 
prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical&#13;assets or 
liabilities;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 2 - 
observable inputs other than Level 1, quoted prices for&#13;similar assets or 
liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar assets and
liabilities in markets that&#13;are not active, and model-derived prices whose 
inputs are observable or whose significant value drivers are observable; 
and&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; 
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 3 - assets 
and liabilities whose significant value drivers&#13;are 
unobservable.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times 
New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;As of reporting period, the Company did 
not have any assets or liabilities&#13;that were measured at fair value on a 
recurring or non-recurring basis.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Observable inputs are based on market data obtained 
from independent&#13;sources, while unobservable inputs are based on the 
Company&amp;#146;s market assumptions. Unobservable inputs require 
significant&#13;management judgment or estimation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In some 
cases, the inputs used to measure an asset or liability may fall into 
different&#13;levels of the fair value hierarchy.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In those 
instances, the fair value measurement is required to be classified using&#13;the
lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. Such 
determination requires significant 
management&#13;judgment.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Financial instruments, which include cash, accounts
payable, and&#13;loans and borrowings, were estimated to approximate their 
carrying values due to the immediate or short-term maturity of 
these&#13;financial instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The fair value of amounts 
due to related parties are not practical to estimate, due to the 
related&#13;party nature of the underlying transactions.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The 
financial risk to the Company&amp;#146;s operations arises from 
fluctuations&#13;in foreign exchange rates and the degree of volatility of these
rates. Currently, the Company does not use derivative instruments&#13;to reduce 
its exposure to foreign currency risk.&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-
31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr
style="vertical-align: top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;h.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company recognizes deferred tax assets and 
liabilities for the&#13;future tax consequences attributable to differences 
between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and 
liabilities&#13;and their tax bases, as well as net operating 
losses.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif;
margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Deferred tax 
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax&#13;rates expected to 
apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are 
expected to be recovered or settled.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The&#13;effect on 
deferred tax assets or liabilities of a change in tax rates is recognized in the
period in which the tax change occurs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A&#13;valuation 
allowance is provided to reduce the deferred tax assets to a level, that more 
likely than not, will be realized.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt 
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Management does not believe that the Company has any
unrecognized&#13;tax positions. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize 
interest and penalties accrued on any unrecognized tax benefits as 
a&#13;component of income tax expense.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt
Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy 
contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;i.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Stock-Based 
Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company accounts for share-based payments under 
the fair value&#13;method of accounting for stock-based compensation consistent 
with US GAAP.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the fair value method, stock-
based&#13;compensation cost is measured at the grant date based on the fair 
value of the award using the Black-Sholes option pricing model&#13;and is 
recognized to expense on a straight-line basis over the requisite service 
period, which is generally the vesting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Where&#13;upon
grant the options vest immediately the stock-based costs are expensed 
immediately.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ShareBasedCompensationOptionAndIncentivePlansPolicy>
<us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock 
contextRef="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31">&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;j.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Foreign Currency Translation and 
Transactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, 
Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s functional and reporting 
currency is the United&#13;States dollar.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Monetary assets and
liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated into the United 
States&#13;dollar using the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet 
date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Gains and losses arising on settlement 
of&#13;foreign currency denominated transactions or balances are included in the
determination of income.&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New 
Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;</us-
gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock>

&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-align: 
center"&gt;8,000,000&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="vertical-align:

$30,260).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p

0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style="vertical-align: 
top"&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, 
Serif; text-align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;b.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;The Company incurred management fees provided by the CEO during the 
three and nine months ended May 31, 2013 of $0 and $64.431 respectively (prior 
periods: $42,640 and $130,161 
respectively).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing="0"

8pt"&gt;c.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td 
style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;Included in&amp;#160;general and administrative expenses&amp;#160;during
the three and nine months ended May 31, 2013 were $64,813 and $130,317 for CFO, 
Administration, Company Secretarial, Office Services and Support fees recognized
for services performed by Coresco AG (prior period: $31,980 and $79,950)

period: $nil and

nsationCostNotYetRecognizedStockOptions" xlink:type="arc" />
    </link:presentationLink>
    <link:presentationLink xlink:type="extended" 
xlink:role="http://panexresources.com/role/RelatedPartyTransactionsDetailsNarrat
ive" xlink:title="0019 - Disclosure - 4. Related Party Transactions (Details 
Narrative)">
      <link:loc xlink:type="locator" xlink:href="dbgf-

<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: 2. Summary of Significant Accounting Policies

yPrevioslyReportedAsRow>false</IsEquityPrevioslyReportedAsRow><IsEquityAdjustmen
tRow>false</IsEquityAdjustmentRow><IsBeginningBalance>false</IsBeginningBalance>

tnoteIndexer /><Cells><Cell FlagID="0" ContextID="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31"
