ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;2.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;a.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Basis of 
Preparation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;These 
financial statements and related notes are presented in accordance
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (US 
GAAP).&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s fiscal year-end is
August 31.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;b.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
preparation of financial statements in conformity with US GAAP
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure
of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenues and expenses
during the reporting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Actual results could differ from
those estimates.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;c.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Basic and Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per 
Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Earnings 
(loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss)
available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares
outstanding during the reporting period including
common stock issued effective the date committed.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Common 
stock issuable is considered outstanding as of the original
approval date for the purposes of earnings per share 
computations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Diluted earnings (loss) per common share is 
computed
by dividing net earnings (loss) by the sum of (a) the basic weighted average 
number of shares of common stock outstanding during
the period and (b) additional shares that would have been issued and potentially
dilutive securities.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;During the reporting
periods the diluted earnings (loss) per share was equivalent to the basic 
earnings (loss) per share because all potentially dilutive
securities were anti-dilutive due to the net losses 
incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Potentially dilutive securities consist of stock 
options
outstanding at the end of the reporting period.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;d.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Cash&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Cash 
includes deposits in banks, which are unrestricted as to withdrawal
or use.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
&lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;e.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Mineral Property and Exploration 
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company 
has been in the exploration stage since its formation
on May 28, 2004 and has not realized any revenues from its planned 
operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;It has been primarily engaged in the
acquisition and exploration of mining properties.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Mineral 
property acquisition and exploration costs are expensed as
incurred.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;When it has been determined that a mineral property
can be economically developed as a result of establishing
proven and probable reserves, the costs incurred to develop such property are 
capitalized.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Such costs will be amortized
using the units-of-production method over the estimated life of the probable 
reserve.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;If mineral properties are subsequently
abandoned or impaired, any capitalized costs will be charged to 
operations.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;f.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Deferred Acquisition 
Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company 
capitalizes deposits paid during the acquisition of equity
interests as deferred acquisition costs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Deferred acquisition
costs are recorded at cost and are included in the purchase
price of the equity interest once the acquisition has been 
consummated.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;g.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Fair value 
is defined as the price that would be received to sell
an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between 
market participants at the measurement date in the principal
or most advantageous market. The Company uses a fair value hierarchy that has 
three levels of inputs, both observable and unobservable,
with use of the lowest possible level of input to determine fair 
value.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 1 - 
quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical
assets or liabilities;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 2 - 
observable inputs other than Level 1, quoted prices for
similar assets or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or 
similar assets and liabilities in markets that
are not active, and model-derived prices whose inputs are observable or whose 
significant value drivers are observable; and&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Level 3 - 
assets and liabilities whose significant value drivers
are unobservable.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;As of 
reporting period, the Company did not have any assets or liabilities
that were measured at fair value on a recurring or non-recurring 
basis.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Observable 
inputs are based on market data obtained from independent
sources, while unobservable inputs are based on the Company&amp;#146;s market 
assumptions. Unobservable inputs require significant
management judgment or estimation.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In some cases, the inputs 
used to measure an asset or liability may fall into different
levels of the fair value hierarchy.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In those instances, the 
fair value measurement is required to be classified using
the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. 
Such determination requires significant management
judgment.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Financial 
instruments, which include cash, accounts payable, and
loans and borrowings, were estimated to approximate their carrying values due to
the immediate or short-term maturity of these
financial instruments.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The fair value of amounts due to 
related parties are not practical to estimate, due to the related
party nature of the underlying transactions.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The financial 
risk to the Company&amp;#146;s operations arises from fluctuations
in foreign exchange rates and the degree of volatility of these rates. 
Currently, the Company does not use derivative instruments
to reduce its exposure to foreign currency risk.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;h.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company 
recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities for the
future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial 
statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities
and their tax bases, as well as net operating losses.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Deferred tax
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax
rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary 
differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The
effect on deferred tax assets or liabilities of a change in tax rates is 
recognized in the period in which the tax change occurs.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;A
valuation allowance is provided to reduce the deferred tax assets to a level, 
that more likely than not, will be realized.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Management 
does not believe that the Company has any unrecognized
tax positions. The Company&amp;#146;s policy is to recognize interest and 
penalties accrued on any unrecognized tax benefits as a
component of income tax expense.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;i.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Stock-Based 
Compensation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The Company 
accounts for share-based payments under the fair value
method of accounting for stock-based compensation consistent with US 
GAAP.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Under the fair value method, stock-based
compensation cost is measured at the grant date based on the fair value of the 
award using the Black-Sholes option pricing model
and is recognized to expense on a straight-line basis over the requisite service
period, which is generally the vesting period.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Where
upon grant the options vest immediately the stock-based costs are expensed 
immediately.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;j.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Foreign Currency Translation and 
Transactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s functional and reporting currency is the United
States dollar.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in
foreign currencies are translated into the United States
dollar using the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet 
date.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Gains and losses arising on settlement of
foreign currency denominated transactions or balances are included in the 
determination of income.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;k.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Concentration of Credit 
Risk&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments that are exposed to concentration
of credit risk consist of cash.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The Company&amp;#146;s cash 
is in demand deposit accounts placed with federally insured
financial institutions in Canada.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;l.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Interim Financial 
Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In the 
opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited condensed
financial statements contain all adjustments which include only normal recurring
adjustments, necessary to present fairly the Company&amp;#146;s
financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods shown. 
The results of operations for such periods are
not necessarily indicative of the results expected for a full year or for any 
future period.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
unaudited financial statements should be read in conjunction
with the Company&amp;#146;s audited financial statements and footnotes thereto 
for the year ended August 31, 2012, which are included
in the Company&amp;#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;m.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;Recent Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Management 
has evaluated any recently issued accounting pronouncements
to determine their applicability and does not believe that any of these 
pronouncements will have a significant impact on the Company&amp;#146;s
financial statements.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer

/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

/Cells><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>
monetary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes

/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

/><Cells 
/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the

amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

referredLabelRole>periodEndLabel</PreferredLabelRole><FootnoteIndexer 
/><Cells 
/><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monet
ary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity 
(deficit) items, net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and 
affiliates of the entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the
economic entity's stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the 
amount of stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in 
subsidiary equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling 
interest, minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes 
called permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

DataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>monetary</Simpl
eDataType><ElementDefenition>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, 
net of receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the 
entity which are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Amount of difference between fair value of the underlying 
shares reserved for issuance and exercise price of vested portions of options 
outstanding and currently exercisable.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display:

              </div>
            </div>

          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a

Definition</a><div>
                <p>The costs incurred to retain exploration and property rights 
after acquisition but before production has occurred. Costs include legal costs 
for title defense, ad valorem taxes on nonproducing mineral properties, shut-in 
royalties, and delay rentals.</p>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_EarningsPerShareBasicAndDiluted">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The amount of net income or loss for the period per each 
share in instances when basic and diluted earnings per share are the same amount
and reported as a single line item on the face of the financial statements.  
Basic earnings per share is the amount of net income or loss for the period per 
each share of common stock or unit outstanding during the reporting period.  
Diluted earnings per share includes the amount of net income or loss for the 
period available to each share of common stock or common unit outstanding during
the reporting period and to each share or unit that would have been outstanding 
assuming the issuance of common shares or units for all dilutive potential 
common shares or units outstanding during the reporting period.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>No definition available.</p>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_GainLossOnInvestments">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>This item represents the net total realized and unrealized 
gain (loss) included in earnings for the period as a result of selling or 
holding marketable securities categorized as trading, available-for-sale, or 
held-to-maturity, including the unrealized holding gain (loss) of held-to-
maturity securities transferred to the trading security category and the 
cumulative unrealized gain (loss) which was included in other comprehensive 
income (a separate component of shareholders' equity) for available-for-sale 
securities transferred to trading securities during the period. Additionally, 
this item would include any gains (losses) realized during the period from the 
sale of investments accounted for under the cost method of accounting and losses
recognized for other than temporary impairments (OTTI) of the subject 
investments.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">

          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>A fee charged for services from professionals such as 
doctors, lawyers and accountants. The term is often expanded to include other 
professions, for example, pharmacists charging to maintain a medicinal profile 
of a client or customer.</p>

of restricted stock or units, and adjustment for officers' compensation. As 
noncash, this element is an add back when calculating net cash generated by 
operating activities using the indirect method.</p>

                <p>Number of [basic] shares or units, after adjustment for 
contingently issuable shares or units and other shares or units not deemed 
outstanding, determined by relating the portion of time within a reporting 
period that common shares or units have been outstanding to the total time in 
that period.</p>

right"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>4.&#160;&#160;</b></font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt"><b>Related Party Transactions</b></font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">a.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">There were no donated services provided by the president of the Company 
during the three and nine months ended May 31, 2013 (May 31, 2012: 
$30,260).</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">b.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">The Company incurred management fees provided by the CEO during the three 
and nine months ended May 31, 2013 of $0 and $64.431 respectively (prior 
periods: $42,640 and $130,161 respectively).</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">

and nine months ended May 31, 2013 were $64,813 and $130,317 for CFO, 
Administration, Company Secretarial, Office Services and Support fees recognized
for services performed by Coresco AG (prior period: $31,980 and $79,950) 
including the amount paid to the Chief Financial Officer.</font></td></tr>
</table>

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The entire disclosure for related party transactions. 
Examples of related party transactions include transactions between (a) a parent
company and its subsidiary; (b) subsidiaries of a common parent; (c) and entity 
and its principal owners; and (d) affiliates.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>17
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/**
 * Rivet Software Inc.
 *
 * @copyright Copyright (c) 2006-2011 Rivet Software, Inc. All rights reserved.
 * Version 2.4.0.3
 *
 */
var Show = {};
Show.LastAR = null,
Show.hideAR = function(){
Show.LastAR.style.display = 'none';
};
Show.showAR = function ( link, id, win ){
if( Show.LastAR ){
Show.hideAR();
}
var ref = link;
do {
ref = ref.nextSibling;
} while (ref && ref.nodeName != 'TABLE');
if (!ref || ref.nodeName != 'TABLE') {
var tmp = win ?
win.document.getElementById(id) :
document.getElementById(id);
if( tmp ){
ref = tmp.cloneNode(true);
ref.id = '';
link.parentNode.appendChild(ref);
}
}
if( ref ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
Show.LastAR = ref;
}
};
Show.toggleNext = function( link ){
var ref = link;
do{
ref = ref.nextSibling;
}while( ref.nodeName != 'DIV' );
if( ref.style &&
ref.style.display &&
ref.style.display == 'none' ){
ref.style.display = 'block';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '+', '-' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '+', '-' );
}
}else{
ref.style.display = 'none';
if( link.textContent ){
link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '-', '+' );
}else{
link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '-', '+' );
}
}
};
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>

&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In August 
2012, the Company's Board of Directors approved the issuance
of stock options as an incentive to obtain services of key employees, directors 
and consultants of the Company.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The
following is a summary of stock option activity and the status of stock options 
outstanding and exercisable at May 31, 2013:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;The 
aggregate intrinsic value in the table above represents the total
pre-tax intrinsic value for all &amp;#147;in-the-money&amp;#148; options (i.e. 
the difference between the Company&amp;#146;s closing stock
price on the last trading day of the fiscal year and the exercise price, 
multiplied by the number of shares) that would have been
received by the option holders had all option holders exercised their options on
May 31, 2013.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Effective 
August 3, 2012, the Company&amp;#146;s board of directors
granted 8,000,000 stock purchase options.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Each of the options
has an issue date, effective date and vesting date of
August 3, 2012, with an exercise price of $0.08 per 
share.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The term of these options is five 
years.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The options
are exercisable at any time from the grant date up to and including August 2, 
2017.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There is no unrecognised compensation
expense at February 28, 2013.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;All related compensation 
expense was recognized on August 31, 2012 as the options were
vested in full on that date.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer

    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-

8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;6.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Material Contingencies and 
Commitments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;Panex has no
material contingencies or long-term commitments.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 
0"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;While Panex 
has raised capital to meet its working capital and financing
needs in the past, additional financing is required in order to fully complete 
its plan of operation and launch its business 
operations.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex
is seeking financing in the form of equity in order to provide the necessary 
working capital.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Panex currently has no
commitments for financing.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;There are no assurances Panex will
be completely successful in raising the funds 
required.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer /><CurrencyCode

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_DebtConversionConvertedInstrumentAmount1">
        <tr>
<td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The value of the financial instrument(s) that the original 
debt is being converted into in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part 
noncash" refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash 
receipts or cash payments in the period.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 230<br><br> -SubTopic 
10<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 5<br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6367179&amp;loc=d3e4332-
108586<br><br><br><br>Reference 2: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 230<br><br> -SubTopic 
10<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 3<br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6367179&amp;loc=d3e4304-
108586<br><br><br><br></p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;">
                <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
                    <td><nobr>us-
gaap_DebtConversionConvertedInstrumentAmount1</nobr></td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td style="padding-right: 4px;"><nobr><strong> Namespace 
Prefix:</strong></nobr></td>
                    <td>us-gaap_</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>xbrli:monetaryItemType</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>credit</td>
                  </tr>
                  <tr>
                    <td><strong> Period Type:</strong></td>
                    <td>duration</td>
                  </tr>
                </table>
              </div>
            </div>
          </td>
        </tr>
      </table>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-
gaap_DebtConversionConvertedInstrumentSharesIssued1">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
<tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The number of shares issued in exchange for the original debt
being converted in a noncash (or part noncash) transaction. "Part noncash" 
refers to that portion of the transaction not resulting in cash receipts or 
payments in the period.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br> 
-Name Accounting Standards Codification<br><br> -Topic 230<br><br> -SubTopic 
10<br><br> -Section 50<br><br> -Paragraph 5<br><br> -URI 
http://asc.fasb.org/extlink&amp;oid=6367179&amp;loc=d3e4332-
108586<br><br><br><br>Reference 2: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br>

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
<td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The aggregate amount of noncash, equity-based employee 
remuneration. This may include the value of stock or unit options, amortization 
of restricted stock or units, and adjustment for officers' compensation. As 
noncash, this element is an add back when calculating net cash generated by 
operating activities using the indirect method.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display:

      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_StockholdersEquity">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Total of all stockholders' equity (deficit) items, net of 
receivables from officers, directors, owners, and affiliates of the entity which
are attributable to the parent. The amount of the economic entity's 
stockholders' equity attributable to the parent excludes the amount of 
stockholders' equity which is allocable to that ownership interest in subsidiary
equity which is not attributable to the parent (noncontrolling interest, 
minority interest). This excludes temporary equity and is sometimes called 
permanent equity.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">
                <p>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br><br> -Publisher FASB<br><br>

          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>Equity impact of the value of stock that has been repurchased
and retired during the period. The excess of the purchase price over par value 
can be charged against retained earnings (once the excess is fully allocated to 
additional paid in capital).</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);"

<html>

  <body><span style="display: none;">v2.4.0.8</span><table class="report" 
border="0" cellspacing="2" id="ID0ELE">
      <tr>
        <th class="tl" colspan="1" rowspan="2">
          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>2. Summary of Significant 
Accounting Policies<br></strong></div>
        </th>
        <th class="th" colspan="1">9 Months Ended</th>
</tr>
      <tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>May 31, 2013</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_DBGF_NotesToFinancialStatementsAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to 
Financial Statements</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock', window );">2. Summary of 
Significant Accounting Policies</a></td>
        <td class="text"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>2.&#160;&#160;</b></font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt"><b>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</b></font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">a.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Basis of Preparation</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">These financial 
statements and related notes are presented in accordance
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (US 
GAAP).&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s fiscal year-end is
August 31.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">b.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Use of Estimates</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The preparation of
financial statements in conformity with US GAAP
requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported 
amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure
of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenues and expenses
during the reporting period.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ from those 
estimates.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">c.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Basic and Diluted Net Income (Loss) Per Share</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Earnings (loss) 
per share is computed by dividing net income (loss)
available to common stockholders by the weighted average number of common shares
outstanding during the reporting period including
common stock issued effective the date committed.&#160;&#160;Common stock 
issuable is considered outstanding as of the original
approval date for the purposes of earnings per share 
computations.&#160;&#160;Diluted earnings (loss) per common share is computed
by dividing net earnings (loss) by the sum of (a) the basic weighted average 
number of shares of common stock outstanding during
the period and (b) additional shares that would have been issued and potentially
dilutive securities.&#160;&#160;During the reporting
periods the diluted earnings (loss) per share was equivalent to the basic 
earnings (loss) per share because all potentially dilutive
securities were anti-dilutive due to the net losses 
incurred.&#160;&#160;Potentially dilutive securities consist of stock options
outstanding at the end of the reporting period.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">d.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Cash</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Cash includes 
deposits in banks, which are unrestricted as to withdrawal
or use.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">e.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
<td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Mineral Property and Exploration Costs</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company has 
been in the exploration stage since its formation
on May 28, 2004 and has not realized any revenues from its planned 
operations.&#160;&#160;It has been primarily engaged in the
acquisition and exploration of mining properties.&#160;&#160;Mineral property 
acquisition and exploration costs are expensed as
incurred.&#160;&#160;When it has been determined that a mineral property can be 
economically developed as a result of establishing
proven and probable reserves, the costs incurred to develop such property are 
capitalized.&#160;&#160;Such costs will be amortized
using the units-of-production method over the estimated life of the probable 
reserve.&#160;&#160;If mineral properties are subsequently
abandoned or impaired, any capitalized costs will be charged to operations.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">f.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Deferred Acquisition Costs</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company 
capitalizes deposits paid during the acquisition of equity
interests as deferred acquisition costs.&#160;&#160;Deferred acquisition costs 
are recorded at cost and are included in the purchase
price of the equity interest once the acquisition has been consummated.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">g.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Fair Value Measurements</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Fair value is 
defined as the price that would be received to sell
an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between 
market participants at the measurement date in the principal
or most advantageous market. The Company uses a fair value hierarchy that has 
three levels of inputs, both observable and unobservable,
with use of the lowest possible level of input to determine fair value.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Level 1 - quoted
prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical
assets or liabilities;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Level 2 - 
observable inputs other than Level 1, quoted prices for
similar assets or liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or 
similar assets and liabilities in markets that
are not active, and model-derived prices whose inputs are observable or whose 
significant value drivers are observable; and</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Level 3 - assets 
and liabilities whose significant value drivers
are unobservable.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">As of reporting 
period, the Company did not have any assets or liabilities
that were measured at fair value on a recurring or non-recurring basis.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Observable inputs 
are based on market data obtained from independent
sources, while unobservable inputs are based on the Company&#146;s market 
assumptions. Unobservable inputs require significant
management judgment or estimation.&#160;&#160;In some cases, the inputs used to 
measure an asset or liability may fall into different
levels of the fair value hierarchy.&#160;&#160;In those instances, the fair 
value measurement is required to be classified using
the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. 
Such determination requires significant management
judgment.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Financial 
instruments, which include cash, accounts payable, and
loans and borrowings, were estimated to approximate their carrying values due to
the immediate or short-term maturity of these
financial instruments.&#160;&#160;The fair value of amounts due to related 
parties are not practical to estimate, due to the related
party nature of the underlying transactions.&#160;&#160;The financial risk to 
the Company&#146;s operations arises from fluctuations
in foreign exchange rates and the degree of volatility of these rates. 
Currently, the Company does not use derivative instruments
to reduce its exposure to foreign currency risk.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">h.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Income Taxes</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company 
recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities for the
future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial 
statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities
and their tax bases, as well as net operating losses.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Deferred tax 
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax
rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which those temporary 
differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&#160;&#160;The
effect on deferred tax assets or liabilities of a change in tax rates is 
recognized in the period in which the tax change occurs.&#160;&#160;A
valuation allowance is provided to reduce the deferred tax assets to a level, 
that more likely than not, will be realized.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Management does 
not believe that the Company has any unrecognized
tax positions. The Company&#146;s policy is to recognize interest and penalties 
accrued on any unrecognized tax benefits as a
component of income tax expense.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">i.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Stock-Based Compensation</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company 
accounts for share-based payments under the fair value
method of accounting for stock-based compensation consistent with US 
GAAP.&#160;&#160;Under the fair value method, stock-based
compensation cost is measured at the grant date based on the fair value of the 
award using the Black-Sholes option pricing model
and is recognized to expense on a straight-line basis over the requisite service
period, which is generally the vesting period.&#160;&#160;Where
upon grant the options vest immediately the stock-based costs are expensed 
immediately.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">j.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Foreign Currency Translation and Transactions</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company&#146;s
functional and reporting currency is the United
States dollar.&#160;&#160;Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign
currencies are translated into the United States
dollar using the exchange rate prevailing at the balance sheet 
date.&#160;&#160;&#160;Gains and losses arising on settlement of
foreign currency denominated transactions or balances are included in the 
determination of income.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">k.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Concentration of Credit Risk</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The Company&#146;s
financial instruments that are exposed to concentration
of credit risk consist of cash.&#160;&#160;The Company&#146;s cash is in demand 
deposit accounts placed with federally insured
financial institutions in Canada.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">l.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Interim Financial Statements</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In the opinion of 
management, the accompanying unaudited condensed
financial statements contain all adjustments which include only normal recurring
adjustments, necessary to present fairly the Company&#146;s
financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods shown. 
The results of operations for such periods are
not necessarily indicative of the results expected for a full year or for any 
future period.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">The unaudited 
financial statements should be read in conjunction
with the Company&#146;s audited financial statements and footnotes thereto for 
the year ended August 31, 2012, which are included
in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt">m.&#160;&#160;</font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">Management has 
evaluated any recently issued accounting pronouncements
to determine their applicability and does not believe that any of these 
pronouncements will have a significant impact on the Company&#146;s
financial statements.</p><span></span></td>
      </tr>
    </table>
    <div style="display: none;">

                <p>The entire disclosure for all significant accounting policies
of the reporting entity.</p>

</LabelSeparator><Level>2</Level><ElementName>us-
gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock</ElementName><ElementPrefix>us-
gaap_</ElementPrefix><IsBaseElement>true</IsBaseElement><BalanceType>na</Balance
Type><PeriodType>duration</PeriodType><IsReportTitle>false</IsReportTitle><IsSeg
mentTitle>false</IsSegmentTitle><IsCalendarTitle>false</IsCalendarTitle><IsEquit
yPrevioslyReportedAsRow>false</IsEquityPrevioslyReportedAsRow><IsEquityAdjustmen
tRow>false</IsEquityAdjustmentRow><IsBeginningBalance>false</IsBeginningBalance>
<IsEndingBalance>false</IsEndingBalance><IsReverseSign>false</IsReverseSign><Foo
tnoteIndexer /><Cells><Cell FlagID="0" ContextID="From2012-09-01to2013-05-31" 
UnitID=""><Id>1</Id><IsNumeric>false</IsNumeric><IsRatio>false</IsRatio><Display
ZeroAsNone>false</DisplayZeroAsNone><NumericAmount>0</NumericAmount><RoundedNume
ricAmount>0</RoundedNumericAmount><NonNumbericText>&lt;table cellspacing="0" 
cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%"&gt;
&lt;tr style="vertical-align: top"&gt;
    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;5.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Loans and 
Borrowings&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In March and
July 2007, the Company received loan proceeds of $240,000
and $500,000 respectively from an unrelated third 
party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;These loans were unsecured bearing interest at 8% per 
annum,
with no fixed repayment date, but the understanding with the lender was that the
loans will be repaid from the proceeds of future
equity financings and/or the repayment of amounts lent to 
Minanca.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;On December 20, 2010, principal of $46,892 and 
interest
of $15,751 was assigned to this third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In December 
2010, $267,072 of this loan as well as $200,310 of accrued
interest on this loan was settled by the issue of 9,347,640 
shares.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;In May 31, 2012 this loan was settled in full for
$560,000, resulting in a gain on extinguishment of $10,426, which is included 
within interest income and other for the year ended
August 31, 2012.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In January 
2011, the Company received loan proceeds of $50,000, from
an unrelated third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This loan was unsecured, and had no
stated interest rate.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This amount was settled
for issuance of 2,500,000 shares of common stock in February 2012.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;In September
and November 2012, the Company received loan proceeds
of $75,000 and $25,000 respectively (totalling $100,000), from an unrelated 
third party.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;The loan is unsecured, and
has no stated interest rate.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;$75,000 of these funds
received was used to pay aged outstanding accounts payable
in December 2012.&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer /><CurrencyCode 
/><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<
/ShowCurrencySymbol><DisplayDateInUSFormat>false</DisplayDateInUSFormat></Cell><
/Cells><ElementDataType>nonnum:textBlockItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataTyp
e>na</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>The entire disclosure for information 
about short-term and long-term debt arrangements, which includes amounts of 
borrowings under each line of credit, note payable, commercial paper issue, 
bonds indenture, debenture issue, own-share lending arrangements and any other 
contractual agreement to repay funds, and about the underlying arrangements, 
rationale for a classification as long-term, including repayment terms, interest
rates, collateral provided, restrictions on use of assets and activities, 
whether or not in compliance with debt covenants, and other matters important to
users of the financial statements, such as the effects of refinancing and 
noncompliance with debt 
covenants.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1: 
http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef

. Loans and Borrowings</Label></Row></Rows><Footnotes

Borrowings</ReportName><MonetaryRoundingLevel>UnKnown</MonetaryRoundingLevel><Sh

erShareRoundingLevel><ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>UnKnown</ExchangeRateRoundingLev
el><HasCustomUnits>true</HasCustomUnits><IsEmbedReport>false</IsEmbedReport><IsM
ultiCurrency>false</IsMultiCurrency><ReportType>Sheet</ReportType><RoleURI>http:
//panexresources.com/role/LoansAndBorrowings</RoleURI><NumberOfCols>1</NumberOfC
ols><NumberOfRows>2</NumberOfRows></InstanceReport>

<TEXT>

          <div style="width: 200px;"><strong>5. Loans and 
Borrowings<br></strong></div>
        </th>
        <th class="th" colspan="1">9 Months Ended</th>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <th class="th">
          <div>May 31, 2013</div>
        </th>
      </tr>
      <tr class="re">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 
'defref_DBGF_NotesToFinancialStatementsAbstract', window );"><strong>Notes to 
Financial Statements</strong></a></td>
        <td class="text">&#xA0;<span></span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="ro">
        <td class="pl" style="border-bottom: 0px;" valign="top"><a class="a" 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.showAR( this, 'defref_us-
gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock', window );">5. Loans and Borrowings</a></td>
        <td class="text"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 
100%">
<tr style="vertical-align: top">
    <td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align:
right"><font style="font-size: 8pt"><b>5.&#160;&#160;</b></font></td>
    <td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><font style="font-size: 
8pt"><b>Loans and Borrowings</b></font></td></tr>
</table>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In March and July 
2007, the Company received loan proceeds of $240,000
and $500,000 respectively from an unrelated third party.&#160;&#160;These loans 
were unsecured bearing interest at 8% per annum,
with no fixed repayment date, but the understanding with the lender was that the
loans will be repaid from the proceeds of future
equity financings and/or the repayment of amounts lent to Minanca.&#160;&#160;On
December 20, 2010, principal of $46,892 and interest
of $15,751 was assigned to this third party.&#160;&#160;In December 2010, 
$267,072 of this loan as well as $200,310 of accrued
interest on this loan was settled by the issue of 9,347,640 
shares.&#160;&#160;In May 31, 2012 this loan was settled in full for
$560,000, resulting in a gain on extinguishment of $10,426, which is included 
within interest income and other for the year ended
August 31, 2012.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In January 2011, 
the Company received loan proceeds of $50,000, from
an unrelated third party.&#160;&#160;This loan was unsecured, and had no stated 
interest rate.&#160;&#160;This amount was settled
for issuance of 2,500,000 shares of common stock in February 2012.</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in">&#160;</p>
<p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0">In September and 
November 2012, the Company received loan proceeds
of $75,000 and $25,000 respectively (totalling $100,000), from an unrelated 
third party.&#160;&#160;The loan is unsecured, and
has no stated interest rate.&#160;&#160;&#160;$75,000 of these funds received 
was used to pay aged outstanding accounts payable
in December 2012.</p><span></span></td>
      </tr>
    </table>
    <div style="display: none;">
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData"

        </tr>
      </table>
      <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" 
style="display: none;" id="defref_us-gaap_DebtDisclosureTextBlock">
        <tr>
          <td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td>
            <div class="body" style="padding: 2px;"><a 
href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- 
Definition</a><div>
                <p>The entire disclosure for information about short-term and 
long-term debt arrangements, which includes amounts of borrowings under each 
line of credit, note payable, commercial paper issue, bonds indenture, debenture
issue, own-share lending arrangements and any other contractual agreement to 
repay funds, and about the underlying arrangements, rationale for a 
classification as long-term, including repayment terms, interest rates, 
collateral provided, restrictions on use of assets and activities, whether or 
not in compliance with debt covenants, and other matters important to users of 
the financial statements, such as the effects of refinancing and noncompliance 
with debt covenants.</p>
              </div><a href="javascript:void(0);" 
onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: 
none;">

    &lt;td style="width: 48px; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-
align: right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;8.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
    &lt;td style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 8pt"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Subsequent 
Events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0; text-indent: 
0.5in"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0"&gt;On June 20, 
2013, Panex reached an agreement with Klaus Eckhof and
Ross Doyle to cancel all of their outstanding stock options with 
Panex.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;As a result of the cancellation of the 8 million
stock options Panex currently has no outstanding stock options.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0pt"&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</NonNumbericText><FootnoteIndexer 
/><CurrencyCode /><CurrencySymbol 
/><IsIndependantCurrency>false</IsIndependantCurrency><ShowCurrencySymbol>false<
/ShowCurrencySymbol><DisplayDateInUSFormat>false</DisplayDateInUSFormat></Cell><
/Cells><ElementDataType>nonnum:textBlockItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataTyp
e>na</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>The entire disclosure for significant 
events or transactions that occurred after the balance sheet date through the 
date the financial statements were issued or the date the financial statements 
were available to be issued. Examples include: the sale of a capital stock 
issue, purchase of a business, settlement of litigation, catastrophic loss,
significant foreign exchange rate changes, loans to insiders or affiliates, and 
transactions not in the ordinary course of 
business.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>No definition 
available.</ElementReferences><IsTotalLabel>false</IsTotalLabel><UnitID>0</UnitI
D><Label>8. Subsequent Events</Label></Row></Rows><Footnotes 
/><IsEquityReport>false</IsEquityReport><ReportName>8. Subsequent 
Events</ReportName><MonetaryRoundingLevel>UnKnown</MonetaryRoundingLevel><Shares
RoundingLevel>UnKnown</SharesRoundingLevel><PerShareRoundingLevel>UnKnown</PerSh
areRoundingLevel><ExchangeRateRoundingLevel>UnKnown</ExchangeRateRoundingLevel><
HasCustomUnits>true</HasCustomUnits><IsEmbedReport>false</IsEmbedReport><IsMulti
Currency>false</IsMultiCurrency><ReportType>Sheet</ReportType><RoleURI>http://pa
nexresources.com/role/SubsequentEvents</RoleURI><NumberOfCols>1</NumberOfCols><N
umberOfRows>2</NumberOfRows></InstanceReport>
</XBRL>

<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: Balance Sheets
<TEXT>
<XBRL>
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="us-ascii"?><InstanceReport 
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"

/Cells><ElementDataType>xbrli:monetaryItemType</ElementDataType><SimpleDataType>
monetary</SimpleDataType><ElementDefenition>Sum of the carrying amounts as of 
the balance sheet date of all assets that are expected to be realized in cash, 
sold, or consumed within one year (or the normal operating cycle, if longer). 
Assets are probable future economic benefits obtained or controlled by an entity
as a result of past transactions or 
events.</ElementDefenition><ElementReferences>Reference 1:
